justification: “Need For Cognition (NFC)…assesses intrinsic motivation to engage in cognitive deliberation.”

measured_by: Rational Ability subscale of the Rational Experiential Inventory
justification: “Rational Ability (RA), which indexes ability to think logically and analytically…these are subscales of the Rational Experiential Inventory (REI).”

measured_by: Rational Engagement subscale of the Rational Experiential Inventory
justification: “Rational Engagement (RE)…gauges reliance on and enjoyment of thinking in an analytical, logical manner—these are subscales of the Rational Experiential Inventory (REI).”
“Actively Open-Minded Thinking (AOT)…assesses individual differences in disposition to be fair towards different conclusions… and to consider carefully the opinions of others in forming one's own.”
“Belief Bias (BB)…measures the tendency to uncritically accept evidence when it favors prior beliefs, and to dismiss…evidence that supports a conclusion that one does not agree with.”
“Cognitive Reflection Test (CRT)…measures individuals' ability to suppress an intuitive response in favor of a more reflective and deliberative response.”

measured_by: Model-based control parameter (w) from two-step reinforcement-learning tasks
justification: “We measured participants' degree of model-based control using … two-step task…model-based control in these tasks requires effortful thinking.”
construct: Effortful, model-based reasoning in decision making

measured_by: Cortical thickness of dorsolateral prefrontal cortex
justification: “Individual differences in cortical thickness of dlPFC (a neuroanatomical measure associated with deliberative reasoning, complex planning, and goal-directed reasoning)…were tested.”

measured_by: Utilitarian parameter from Process Dissociation moral dilemma task
justification: “The process dissociation (PD) approach…allows independent measurement of…utilitarian tendencies.”

measured_by: Deontological parameter from Process Dissociation moral dilemma task
justification: “The central idea underlying PD…dissociate…deontological and utilitarian inclinations…providing separate parameters for each.”
